desc: Throughout my relationship with my gf, I had themes that center around people and if I find those people attractive. These are people that I had never found attractive before hand and that I truly have no attraction for.These themes tho have also helped cured while being intimate with my gf. The thought of me doing it with the other people would pop up and basically pull me away from the moment because I would try to fight off the thoughts. This has happened with abt like 5 people if I remember correctly. I wish I had bad memory so I could forget all of that.Fast forward to yesterday and I‚Äôm watching the movie Raging Bull and he asks his partner if she had ever thought of someone else while they were in bed. This instantly reminded me that I have done that and starting from then I have felt like shit and guilty and thinking I should tell my gf.I eventually tell my gf and she has a breakdown and asks me who has popped into my head. I had to lie and say it would be like models or celebrities. I tell her that they are only intrusive thoughts which is not a lie. But I‚Äôm scared if she asks if I have thought of everyone we know and I will have to lie. I will have to. If not she will break up with me. What do you all think abt this I need as much advice as possible.

Does anyone else struggle with this? I hate saying it or even thinking about it but I had worms for a few years as a child and was too ashamed to tell anyone about it. I didn‚Äôt know what to do I would just pray over and over. They finally went away from what I could tell. I‚Äôm still paranoid that they are in me. If I could go back I‚Äôd tell someone immediately. I thought there was something wrong with me at the time. It‚Äôs keeping me up rn because I‚Äôm slightly irritated down there, and years after it happened I read about how they tend to exit you at night. I started thinking about tapeworms and I‚Äôm super worried I have one of those somehow.I don‚Äôt mess with dirt, but I did plant a few succulents leaves a few days ago but didn‚Äôt really touch it with my fingers but what if I messed up somehow. I would go into panic mode if it ever happens to me again.

CW: brief SA allegations are mentioned.I don‚Äôt have OCD; an ex friend does, however. I‚Äôm wondering if this could possibly be tied in? For some background, I haven‚Äôt spoken to ‚ÄúL‚Äù in nearly two years. Without too many details, he was an abusive asshole. I wasn‚Äôt a saint myself, but a lot of what I did stems from reactive abuse, as I‚Äôve found out with the help of a therapist.What worries me is his attitude now, however. It wasn‚Äôt exactly a clean break; a lot of people got fed up with him for how he treated both them and me, including his partner of four years, and most of his friends.Some of his new friends reached out with concern over his behaviour; it turns out that he‚Äôs made me into some huge monster, with near-daily messages blaming me for his issues, or exaggerating things that happened. Me forgetting to feed my snake Sunday evening and waiting until Monday morning has turned into weeks without food or water. Me asking him to watch a series and warning him about dark content beforehand? I forced him to even when he cried. His lack of communication? My fault. His problem behaviours? My fault, even the ones he‚Äôd admitted were there before we even met. The list goes on; he‚Äôs even went as far as to accuse me of sexual assault, despite there being proof of the contrary. As I said, it‚Äôs been nearly two years. I‚Äôve seen all the screenshots of his behaviours, and I‚Äôm honestly worried for him;  it‚Äôs straight up obsessive, and he seems to genuinely believe what he‚Äôs saying. I‚Äôm not angry, or trying to demonize OCD; I‚Äôm just wondering if this could be connected to it, and if so how?The friends of L‚Äôs I mentioned were rightfully wary to contact me, but they‚Äôre listening now that I‚Äôve shown them proof in the form of chat logs, videos and more. They‚Äôre planning on staging an intervention down the line, and hopefully getting him the help he needs.TLDR, could OCD cause that? I‚Äôm honestly less upset, more worried after seeing everything.

I guess I wanna know if anybody else in this sub can relate.

Ive been recovering from OCD in therapy for a while now and Im on the home stretch. I made a hierarchy chart and started working on my least anxiety inducing compulsions to my most severe. Im making this post to let you all know recovery is a slow process, but its the only way youll live a better life. You cannot shortcut it by trying to stop your compulsions all at once, youll just make everything worse. Know that everyones OCD and recovery journey will be unique, and do not compare yours to anyone elses, its a waste of time. Its okay to be uncomfortable and challenge your compulsions, I know it feels like it wont get better, but it will. Please speak to a professional, if you do not have access to one, as i said earlier try to set up challenging your OCD in ways you know you can manage. I know the process sounds long, boring and uncomfortable, but if you dont start recover it will only get worse. You got this. :)

We met and kissed and I enjoyed it and I cried when he left, then yesterday I started feeling guilty like I didn‚Äôt want him. I feel like he doesn‚Äôt make me happy and a boy isn‚Äôt what I want, a girl is, and I‚Äôm stressing, I finally thought I found my person and settled down but clearly notüò≠üíîI‚Äôm panicking so much it just comes and goes I‚Äôm nearly 17 now. Hes coming to see me Friday but I feel sick from stress. I just hope I like him again when I see him because I really really fancied him:( I feel disgusted when I look at him and have no attraction pls help

Yesterday I was getting my daughter out the car on a busy road and a bus drove past  (City of Edinburgh) and I can only imagine if she decided to run on the road and that bus hit her, she was dead.  This thought has been coming into my head constantly and giving me mini panic attacks where I almost scream to myself and say  No no no in my head  I keep saying to myself  thanks brain, for letting me realize I only want to protect my daughter  but the panic still remains.Honestly whats the point anymore, this is the worst one for a while as the thought of my baby dying is absolutely killing me, and I feel like  whats the point anymore?  Whats the point in going on anymore if I am going to panic over something that didnt happen Im now officially giving up, because OCD has attacked my most pride in life my daughter, so its wonAre you glad OCD?  Are you glad you have won and I now want to die?

I have a hard time understanind and analyzing myself, with my ongoing therapy I fear to seem to unstable to the therapist and I end up dampening stuff and exagerating other stuff to kind of level the line of what I believe would be believable and correct for who I am.I am literally unable to focus on myself and understand myself and what I feel.This is OCD, as I am having diagnose doubt, but I also fear this since day 0 of my diagnoses, since I was first diagnosed with GAD, then had ADHD checked and then they got that I was OCD.Medication are doing something, but I dont know if that is just placebo, I dont feel that much difference? But maybe even this is a doubt.Talking with the therapist is my priority at my next session, in the meanwhile, what is your experience about diagnoses doubts and other conditions?

the thing i‚Äôve been obsessing and getting paranoid over lately just cannot leave my mind. i remembered some more stuff that proves i‚Äôm not the person i‚Äôm telling myself i am but why can‚Äôt i just accept it? it‚Äôs kind of like i have all the answers yet i still can‚Äôt get past this. i have been making a little progress compared to the past few days but i still can‚Äôt stop feeling paranoid and telling myself that i‚Äôm a terrible and creepy person.

I dont like going out, going out is depressing, it is so tiring, it is just lost time.I force myself out sometimes but I also cant stand the fact that when I dont go out I feel like I am missing out on life.My friends usually go out 1-3 times a week depending on the work, but sometimes it become a bit too much, where even if for 1-2 hours they would go out even on a Wednesday night.I struggle with sleep, I struggle with a routine, I need to take meds before going to bed and I would prefer to avoid alcohol as much as I can (I dont even like it that much).​Is it that bad to just go out 1-2 times a week on the weekend? I feel like I cant have the same life as everyone else, not that I want to, its just the fear of missing out that is OCD by itself but also kind of real.

I don‚Äôt know exactly if it is related to ocd. But since my childhood(with ocd) i had and do have the problem of some kind of disorganised speech. And simply missing and forgetting words and even letters in sentence. E.g. instead of ‚ÄúI am going to New York‚Äù I would sometimes type ‚ÄúI am to New York‚Äù. Yet still I ma occur when i am concentrated or not- it appears randomly. Recently it began to happen mostly everyday. Anybody knows what it might be? In my guess, it may be inherent kind of abnormal change in brain?..

has anyone looked at more and more extreme and/or degenerate porn over time? and has it affected your OCD? a therapist i once had said this happens to people, especially young men, sometimes. for me basically anything ‚Äútaboo‚Äù, even disgusting hentai that should be illegal will make me feel aroused even if i feel disgusted and extremely anxious when i come across it. is this normal? am i just fucked for life? will i eventually go on to be into real life sex crimes? i ask myself shit like this all the timenow. i try to stick to vanilla shit but i often end up looking at weird taboo porn or hentai (nothing illegal tho). and yes i know ‚Äúquit porn, do nofap‚Äù but thats way easier said than done for me. i‚Äôm just trying to gauge if anything similar has happened/is happening to anyone here. do you eventually go back to normal?

My ocd and anxiety took over at 20. Then depression and other stuff kicked in. The years went on. I tried more than once. I never got the treatment plan, monitoring, help or support I needed. Now I‚Äôm 26 and 7 years of my life have been wasted. I can‚Äôt get over this. I feel like I can‚Äôt breathe thinking about it. I see girls getting help in residential treatment, programs, plans, I never for any help and now I‚Äôm dying.

I never thought I‚Äôd be posting here. I‚Äôve been recovered from my religious OCD for about nine months now. Ocd took away everything I ever loved. I‚Äôm relapsing because I went back to weaker meds. I‚Äôve left my old religion (Islam). Yet the religious ocd has shifted and tells me ‚Äúwhy did you leave? Maybe it was the right religion? Maybe it was the truth?‚Äù I can‚Äôt find any reasons why I left that religion. Now I‚Äôm stuck. I‚Äôm so afraid. I find it so hard even being alone because I get so terrified of the vulnerability a silent headspace can create. All I know is that, I hated that religion. I hate the concept of religion itself. The outdated concept of it. I was never a big fan of the abrahamic faiths. I‚Äôm just so scared. Im craving reassurance so badly. Can someone please help? I never knew I was going to relapse once again.

Almost like I am on caffeine and I feel like every single thought that occurs in my head I could possibly act on which scares me and makes me seek control even more. Recently my OCD has been debilitating. It has taken over my entire life and for the past few weeks I would just sit in the corner of my couch and just cry. I couldn‚Äôt watch TV, go on my phone, do anything. Recently I went to my doctor and she upped my prescription for Citalopram. I have been able to fight my compulsions more than even a few days ago but my emotions feel so dull. I feel emotions but they‚Äôre capped and it‚Äôs starting to become something I‚Äôm fixated on. My nightly routine takes me around 2 hours and what it consists of is:Washing my face, brushing my teeth and braiding my hair in two braids. But my OCD compulsions get so bad that it takes me forever to do anything. For the past 2 nights I have just strictly washed my face and brushed my teeth and get into bed without the usual (going into the kitchen 4 times, washing my hands 4 times, touching doorknobs 4 times, etc)Tonight I was playing Animal Crossing for a little bit too long (which even then is exhausting cause playing games make me have compulsions too - walk in a certain way, you can‚Äôt do a task until this time etc) and now I‚Äôm tired and I don‚Äôt feel like doing my full skincare routine. But now from my emotions being so dull and capped from my medication I feel like I don‚Äôt care anymore about the people I love because I don‚Äôt have these strong urges to do my compulsions like I did before and I‚Äôm feeling like the world is going to think I‚Äôm ungrateful and take it all away from me which now is making me spiral and is making me just want to start my full OCD nightly routine again because I do care but I‚Äôm just feeling so emotionally dull.Blah. OCD sucks.
I know the deal with OCD, Ive been dealing with it for years: but Im kinda lost on what to do about mental compulsions. Like, purely mental compulsions. What do I do for ERP?

Have any of you ever had this kind of obsession, where you experience intense anxiety and fear that you will never be able to fall in love, for example, and this fear affects your mind so much that you are so unable to choose the right thing in this murky water that you end up in a situation where you really lose your emotions. I know it sounds absurd, but nobody can predict the limits of this thing called ocd. Ive been through such strange things in my life that I think it would give me peace of mind to know that there is someone who has been through this kind of nonsense. I mean, are there people who experience self-fulfilling prophecies about ocd, which could be religious obsessions? For example, you think too much about hell, you fear it too much, you experience it almost as if it were real, and eventually you start to believe that you are going to hell. Its so deeply rooted in you that even as you go on with your life you feel that you belong to hell.

I have really intense health anxiety/ocd. To the point that my therapist has told me to ban WebMD and not to google symptoms, otherwise I will spiral. I have a horrid fear of getting tetanus and a multitude of other diseases. Im also terrified of getting a concussion or my brain getting injured in anyway. Having an aneurysm or stroke is one of my biggest fears. Most of the time anxiety is manageable, until something triggers it of course (if I get sick, or get injured).Today, I hit my head pretty hard at work. It was a metal bar above my head and I stood up and smashed right into it. My legs almost buckled from the impact and I felt a bit disorientated for a minute, but mostly fine. I had a bad headache where I got hit (and still do) but have really no other symptoms.Despite this, though, my ocd is telling me to check my pupils constantly for a concussion. Im paranoid Ill lose my memory and then wont know how to get help because I live alone. Im horrified of falling asleep because I fear Ill sleep through some hematoma and will die in my sleep. I had a sobbing breakdown earlier because I was so scared of dying. I was seriously contemplating to write myself a letter just in case I wake up and dont remember who I am. Realistically, I know Im probably fine. But my brain is really latching on the what if. Anyways, Im just writing this post to get it off my chest. I just needed to get these thoughts out of my head.

There‚Äôs more examples but it‚Äôs literally affecting my quality of life Idk what else to call it than OCD but never went to a therapist. Does anyone have any advice? Or ways they‚Äôve overcome a similar situation.

I don‚Äôt even know anymore if it‚Äôs real-event ocd . I did something so awful just because I was angry and even though when I rationalize that it‚Äôs unlikely to happen, my gut is telling me my life is over, I‚Äôm going to prison and I‚Äôm fucked.My whole life has been a joke so far. I was born dumb, born into a toxic family- it makes sense that it ends like this. Honestly, I never saw myself living as a functioning adult, so yeah, it makes sense that I kill myself right now at 17, instead of living in fear 24/7.

Sometimes I feel ocd is coming and I tell myself ok heck I‚Äôm going out to play some sports or do something worthwhile, knowing that when I‚Äôm doing those things ocd gets better. Whereas if I can‚Äôt find anyone to do those sports with (some of the activities require friends), I start to get a bit apprehensive ocd is coming , thoughts r coming etc etc So, are those stuff considered compulsions, or not?Edit: my opinion is something like this. If my mentality is - I‚Äôm going to play soccer today to cure ocd. Then it‚Äôs not gonna work long term. But if my mentality is, in spite of ocd I‚Äôm going to play soccer today. Whatever comes comes. That‚Äôs the better mindset to have.

I have what my psychiatrist thinks is OCD,more specifically harm OCD. I only was recently just diagnosed with it. But I‚Äôve always had self harm thoughts and homicidal thoughts. But I‚Äôve always been afraid to actually hurt myself even when I want to. It makes me feel like a little bitch. When I use a knife,I‚Äôm never sure how to properly cut myself. I usually just use my own nails or bite myself. And I used to make my cat mad on purpose so they‚Äôd scratch the shit out of me. I had a nurse act like those types of hurting myself didn‚Äôt matter and so now I always feel like I‚Äôm not hurting myself enough Amir like I‚Äôm just doing it for attention. I scratched my arm and hand up a couple days ago but I‚Äôm afraid to tell my therapist because I feel like I‚Äôll be dismissed and treated like it doesn‚Äôt matter

For example, i am disgusted by many different behaviors, like my friends going to sleep without brushing their teeth, i cant walk on my friends carpet without socks on because i feel like it has literal diseases on it (to be fair i dont think shes ever vacuumed in her life), certain silverware can feel contaminated and I cannot share any drinks with anybody. My worst one is that I cant drink out of any cups unless their my own designated ‚Äúsafe‚Äù cups that i know for a fact are clean, or they are paper/plastic. These are just a few too‚Ä¶.HOWEVER, there are some things I dont do that people think are weird. For example, at the gym I actually dont wipe down my machines unless I was sweating badly which is rare.. And I sometimes even sit on a bare public toilet seat if I really have to go. My friends are super shocked about those things considering how obsessive I am about contamination with other stuff. Does anyone else experience this? Like sometimes it just shuts off?

But lately I‚Äôve been thinking ‚Äúwhat if he doesn‚Äôt really like me‚Äù ‚Äúwhat if he‚Äôs talking to other girls other than me‚Äù ‚Äúwhat if he Mets someone he likes more than he does me‚Äù and just these different thoughts I‚Äôve been getting. I have OCD and I never really thought about this one thing I do until today.A few times a week (sometimes every day) I get a feeling in my chest or arm or stomach, and the thought is immediately ‚ÄúI‚Äôm having a heart attack‚Äù. This leads me to checking my heart rate and rhythm over and over and over, and it soothes me a little bit, so I end up googling signs of heart attacks (even though I‚Äôm fully aware of the signs because of how often I google them). Then I convince myself yet again that I‚Äôm having a heart attack, and the cycle continues. I‚Äôve heard that checking compulsively is harmful but I can‚Äôt really see how checking that I‚Äôm not having a heart attack is making it worse than sitting in the terror of thinking I‚Äôm having a heart attack.Can anyone let me know their thoughts on this?

Hello,I have been having this trigger bothering me the last 3 days, terribly, I cant sleep well or stop worrying, and the thing is, I dont know how to apply ERP to it.I would like to ask anyone who reads this that if the scenario Im about to describe sounds RATIONAL to you, please let me know, just want to make sure Im not speaking through ignorance.I went to a soccer game and took my puppy, shes about 15 or 16 weeks old. Due to her age, she hasnt been vaccinated against rabies yet, shes due this Wednesday.We went to the soccer game and she started sniffing around and licking. She licked and bit a piece of clothing or like a strip of cloth that was tied up on a fence. Then I started thinking that what if a rabid animal licked that cloth slightly before I got there? She started licking and biting it minutes, if not seconds after I got there. So I got concerned about her, thinking that she may have had gotten the virus, and since it doesnt act quickly, Im stuck here thinking that she will die in the next few months with no way truly knowing if she actually will.I have read about rabies OCD, its the first time this specific trigger comes to me, and I have seen that usually people with rabies OCD tend not to go out or expose to pets or other animals. Thats not the case with me, I am around my puppy and let her lick me on my face. My concern is her, and I dont know what to expose to in this scenario to get rid of it. I need help with a strategy to deal with it.Thanks in advance, and please, if you think my scenario is rational PLEASE let me know, if not, I dont need reassurance, I just really need a strategy.

Hey - I just started Ritalin a couple of weeks ago and while it has helped my ADHD symptoms (constant background noise, insomnia, poor ability to tell time, being late constantly, inability to sit through a task, hot temper, overstimulation, bad executive function, etc.) it seems to have triggered my OCD symptoms as well. For example, ever since I started, my trichotillomania (hair-pulling) has gotten way worse, I keep replaying the same thoughts and memories in my mind, I get severely agitated when my hands are not washed, I keep panicking thinking I have lost my phone when it is in my pocket or that I have forgotten to close my door when it is right in front of me, intense fear of regretting something,etc. It also seems to make my working memory really bad, I forget almost immediately most things and only remember them later or dont trust my own memory.Has anyone managed to find a med or med combo that tackled both of these disorders/symptoms rather than worsening one or the other? I often hear that stimulants can worsen OCD but I really dont see an alternative because the ADHD is a bigger hindrance on my academic/working life... but this is really causing a lot of stress and breakdowns, especially because its finals season.

(20 M) I have been fighting Pure O OCD all my life. Only recently was I diagnosed with it after finally talking to a doctor about my mental health. I have non-stop thoughts about anything and everything that overlap one another, usually music and repeating words/spelling words/sentences. With that said, I am on 3 medications after the course of several trails trying to find the right fit. These meds are Wellbutrin for my severe depression, Seroquel to slow my thoughts, and Modafinil to help my focus. This combination has been wonderful for me, and Ive done a lot of research on them to be aware of side effects. Now heres where I seriously need help. Over the course of the past few months, Ive noticed that my control over my emotions has become scarily good. As in, I can tell myself to stop sobbing in the shower over my intrusive thoughts and then return to a normal state. I was heaving, crying, going cataonic at moments, and then I told myself Alright cool and stopped instantly. No more tears. No snot or coughing. Just- blank. Like I manually turned the dial. It works for anger and excitement too, although to a lesser degree.This isnt a new development. Ive had this Control since around 18 years old pre medication and diagnosis. I know for a fact Im not a Psychopath nor a Sociopath. Im not bipolar either. My OCD does control my mental emotions however. Outward? Total control. Im only getting better at it and now Im afraid. Google/Bing wont tell me anything other than Steps to control your emotions LOL. I seriously need help. I dont think its my meds nor my OCD. My thoughts hit a hard break when I told myself to stop.

I thought Id managed to finally begin to get better in a non perfectionistic way, but without realising my perfectionism crept in again and last night I was completely overcome by the overwhelming feeling of being inadequateFor the past two years, Ive been trying to work my way through a programme which is proven to help me to overcome my emetophobia, as well as all the other struggles I face. Depression, anorexia, social anxiety, OCD (including perfectionism). My perfectionism is completely debilitating, to the point where I cannot do anything without it creeping in. No matter what I do, the overwhelming feeling of never being good enough overtakes me, so I desperately try to reach clarity as the cognitive dissonance takes over. Well Im on my 16th attempt of this cycle of try to do the programme, thinking this time Im not a perfectionist, starting off in a more flexible way, perfectionism slowly creeping back in, me being completely overcome by feeling like total shit, followed by relapsing in all of my struggles. Every single breakdown in this never ending cycle gets worse and worse. I am seriously considering suicide at this point. I just cant seem to live.

After every session with my therapist I feel like I exaggerated about my struggles. The next session, I tell her that I dont feel like I actually suffer, because for a lot of the day, I think I feel like I am fine. She always tells me she still thinks I have OCD. Maybe Ive become desensitized or disassociated or something, I dont know anymore. A lot of the time I hit myself for no reason or get the urge to say out loud, Shut the hell up. A couple of weeks ago I started getting thoughts of, What if Im transgender and I need to transition even though I dont want to. I started feeling like I didnt like being a man, even though I do. They went away after I stopped paying attention to them, but they came back a couple of days ago. I tried to not give them any meaning or significance, and they have died down a bit, so now I feel like I dont have OCD again. I also often get the feeling that I didnt actually close a tab on my browser, so I have to open one and close it multiple times to feel like I did. It doesnt always happen though.

I, 18 female am suffering with this damned theme and it‚Äôs so degrading. Ive never had issues with trans people, infact alot of my friends are that. But i‚Äôve always been a hyper feminine girl and i‚Äôve always hated looking masculine. I have peachfuzz that makes me insecure and such. I hate pants and baggy shirts because it made me look masculine. Whenever i showed any sign of looking masculine i felt discomfort because it just wasn‚Äôt me, again i‚Äôm a hyperfeminine girl! I always loved doing makeup, wearing dresses and fake nails. I always related to female characters, loved men romantically and sexually. It all started when i was struggiling to keep a job, i was artistically burnt out and i started relating to a character that is canonically under the Trans umbrella, and my mind started saying ‚ÄúWhat if because you relate to him, you want to BE him. What if you identify with what he is?‚Äù Which made me feel uncomfortable. Then it ramped up to ‚ÄúWhat if you‚Äôre Trans?‚Äù and that‚Äôs where i spiralled. I thought this was the end, i couldn‚Äôt eat or sleep, i didn‚Äôt shower for days and lost ALOT of weight. The thoughts soon silenced after a while bc i went to my doctor and got put on prozac, but the what ifs and maybes kept coming in. And then it got worse when my friend who was originally genderfluid came out to me as a trans woman. And that‚Äôs where my mind said ‚ÄúWhat if you are fluid and you then become a man?‚Äù and i panicked. And so here i am. This also got retriggered by HOCD, fear of being lesbian or bi. It fucking sucks. So i‚Äôm like, what the fuck? It makes me feel like i have to accept these thoughts but even when i try, it doesn‚Äôt feel right. It doesn‚Äôt make me feel good.

Hi you all. I just wanted to get this of my mind and see if anyone could relate. I can carry myself quite confidently towards the world, I am very good at upkeeping a confident image. I am an attorney, so this is also very necessary. But my self esteem is absolute shit. Objectively, I can see that I am not dumb, not ugly and not bad at my job. My ocd however wants the reassurance of everyone and I mean everyone, which is (of course) impossible.I really get the need to confess everything I did wrong, so people can see how dumb and bad at my job I am. Same with my physical appearance, which seems to morph into body dysmorphia (not diagnosed though). The worst thing is that no one would suspect a thing because of the way I carry myself (because I also have to as a result of my job). To make things worse, my ocd tries to argue with me about the qualities I think I have. So if I would say for example: I am not dumb, I help people everyday and they are content with the results., ocd replies with: thats only because they didnt see the complete fool you made of yourself in front of the judge. Who even speaks like that??. To make things even more disastrous, I tend to seek reassurance of the people who I deem to be successful. In my field, those are almost all exclusively older men, who try to prey upon my insecurities. Anyone can relate? Or at least have some comforting words, I cant remember thinking something sweet or nice about myself. Also, I hope my post does not seem like bragging or please tell me I am X or Y. I am just so hard on myself, even for having these thoughts, I am completely ripping myself to shreds and I am really tired...

I had OCD growing up, but it was towards things like school grades and money.Later on, I learned to control it by telling myself these things are not important as long as Im healthy.This thought process backfired and now my OCD latched onto my defence of at least Im healthy. Now I have crippling health OCD and it is consuming my every day. I dont know what to do now. I dont know where to seek support, and I was prescribed medication like Zoloft before, but I cant even bring myself to take them due to my compulsive thoughts of what if it makes things worse.

Now this is a brand new technique that I have implemented in the past hour or so(take it with a grain of salt) and I have seen it have some benefits already to combat rumination. Basically, when a brand new intrusive thought occurs you tell your brain, We are going to put a pen in it. What this means is that we are going to solve this problem(whatever the intrusive thought is telling you) later(usually that later never comes). You are tricking your brain into seeing this thought as not being a problem. I have noticed my OCD has been trying to latch onto new themes since I implemented this. It tried to grab onto harm OCD and then health OCD. Your OCD wont like this technique. Youre tricking your brain into thinking we are going to have certainty(even though we wont) later on but right now we are just going to focus on what we were doing. Be my guest, try it out.  P.S. I didnt know what flair to put on this, so I went with discussion. Basically discussing the technique

I am the mom of someone with ocd- i check all these groups and filter out important information for her- as if she sees an example of an intrusive thought it might add on. She was diagnosed two weeks ago. although looking back shes had it for over 10 years. when the diagnosis came i was relieved because now we knew what we were dealing with. It is a fight, but there is hope. Here is what has helped so far, in no particular order 1) go to a therapist - until you find one you like, the first isnt always going to stick- 2) go to a psyciatrist -also find one that is right for you 3) learn about ocd- ted talks, books, podcasts so on 4) advice i got from this reddit is give it a comeback- example get an intrusive thought let them know its not that cash money of them 5) hands in ice water 6) own it, dont hid it and start informing people 7) thinking you wont get better is part of the illness ‚Äî- its been hard and we have a long way to go but seeing it as a monster in your head and not part of you will help you win the fight. - this advice helps those with ocd and those who care for ocd

Long story short, I bullied this kid when I was in my early years of high school. We kind of had a back and forth rivalry, and while we both dished our fair share of shit toward each other, I feel like I did the majority of antagonizing. At the time of course, being a child I did not have the empathy and insight I have now, but since I have gained said empathy and insight I feel absolutely awful for what I did back then. Of course, I cannot take it back, even though I wish I could. This has come at me tenfold the last few years because I have found myself in a very lucky situation in life, when it comes to relationships, finances and overall lifestyle, I have everything I could have asked for and more. I am incredibly grateful for this and understand how lucky I am to have all I have, but whenever I find myself looking at all I have, I feel this gut punching guilt and feel as though I dont deserve all I have. Ive had my dream life practically handed to me, even though I was an absolute turd to people in my past. Only looking back on it now do I realize how I could have hurt that person. At the time they did not seem to have a very good home life, and I was just adding to that pain just so I could fit in and seem cool to impress people. My OCD frequently latches onto this guilt especially when I am feeling happy about something, it just swoops in and ruins it. I have very much learnt my lesson, and after maturing I realize how much of a despicable cunt I was. Does anyone else have this same issue/tips on how to deal with this?

Theres a difference between thoughts/words and actions. You are not what your OCD tries to tell you, especially if youve never done any physical action to make those things true. You will get irrational feelings with OCD and your mind can come up with absolutely anything. But thats why its important to learn how to accept thoughts for what they are. You dont have to beat yourself up over them. I understand how disturbing some of it is, now say you were arguing with someone making lies up about you just to get a response and piss you of. Theyre not going to stop, you mine aswell leave it alone. OCD often endures a fear though, along with anxiety and ive struggled with it for a long time. But really, its all stories in your mind that you cant control. Have you ever had a weird or fucked up dream? You cant control them either, but that doesnt mean thats who you are.

I saw a video the other night of Drew Barrymore talking about perimenopause. Her periods started lasting two weeks long and came every two weeks and were super heavy. All I could think is ‚Äúoh my god, that‚Äôs exactly what happened to me.‚Äù And then all of a sudden this year, my cycle is 40 days long and my periods are so light I literally don‚Äôt need a pad or a tampon‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs barely even there. So now I can‚Äôt stop googling, and it‚Äôs just making me obsess more because the more I researched, the more I convinced myself that at 26, I‚Äôm going through menopause. I want to go to a doctor, but is that reassurance seeking, or is it ‚Äúbetter safe than sorry?‚Äù I want a family someday, and I‚Äôm on the verge of a breakdown over this. I also don‚Äôt have insurance or income at the moment, so I don‚Äôt even know if going to a doctor is an option at the moment. I texted my mom, who‚Äôs a nurse and has been through menopause, and told her that I‚Äôm obsessing over this and can‚Äôt stop googling, that I‚Äôm convinced and all the reasons why. I think I texted her because I know she‚Äôll be straight with me - if she thinks I‚Äôm being irrational, she‚Äôll tell me, and if she thinks it‚Äôs worth looking into, she‚Äôll tell me. It‚Äôs just so hard to tell if I‚Äôm connecting dots that are actually there, or if I‚Äôm ‚Äúmaking up‚Äù the dots and connecting them, you know? I also just want to say that I really appreciate the people in this community. Y‚Äôall are always so supportive and also straight up. Coming here to talk about what I‚Äôm going through with people that understand is like a weight off my soul, and it honestly has saved me from full on panic attacks more than once. I feel less on the verge of a breakdown after typing this all out.

[üöÄDay 00]: I‚Äôve suffered from bad OCD for at least a decade now. I suspect I‚Äôm also ASD and ADHD. Today, I decided to cross recovery bridge and I‚Äôm quite committed. It may be a bit arrogant to start posting advice the very first day I‚Äôve started‚Ä¶ but why the hell not? It‚Äôs gonna be a hard road, so I might as well tread it with a lighthearted swagger that might make it easier for me (and perhaps others)!So I started my own little ERP Therapy (exposure and response prevention) program today, without a therapist. Since it‚Äôs self-directed, I‚Äôm keeping it simple:
  1. Do things that scare me.
  2. Don‚Äôt ruminate.
Literally what ERP stands for. A fine start.I did a lot of things that scared me today, and there‚Äôs one major thing I‚Äôve already learned to do. And that‚Äôs to seize the little moments.I find that when my brain is relaxed, there are a few mini moments where it doesn‚Äôt seem to care much about things which it would be anxious considering in more active times.I view these moments as a kind of ‚ÄúPass Go, Collect $200‚Äù moment where I just capitalize on the moment to tackle a fear.This moment could strike at anytime. For me, it was when my dog put his head on my lap and gave a big, tired-dog sigh üòÜ. I saw something I‚Äôve been afraid to touch for months, and I just grabbed right before laying back into my sofa. It was a remote, by the way. Lol.My brain might scream a bit for doing so, but certainly much less than the more hectic hours of the day today. I even find I gain a bit of compound courage, suddenly being able to leap from one fearsome exposure to the next, having dealt with the first one with the utmost bravado. üè∞üõ°Proud of myself today. Rooting for you also, dear reader. Love and light to all! ‚ú®

i started college this year and made the decision to pair with a random roommate instead of getting an individual room. they told me repeatedly if I had issues with the way my roommate cleaned things or couldnt handle it I could apply for the private room at any point. now its may, and I am still with her. she doesnt touch my dishes, doesnt question the way I do things at all. i told her about my fear of mold and she has gone out of her way to lie to me -- she is a very bad liar -- when something has spoiled and she will take care of it discreetly. even my own parents would often forget some things that she has gotten used to in just a few short months. very happy with her and my decision and its nice to remember that there are people out there who will accommodate your needs

My therapist misdiagnosed me with OCD 2 years ago due to overlapping symptoms I have and probably due to the fact that my mother and older sister both have OCD, so anyway I went down a rabbit hole of researching OCD. However, something I read about and believed contradicts your comments on another post I found on this sub regarding POCD and reassurance. I also am studying to become a therapist and I want to understand any mental disorder my clients might have the very best I can. An academic journal I read was written about a psychologist who would bring her POCD clients to a children‚Äôs playground. At the playground, her and her client would sit on a bench where they could see the kids playing but the kids couldn‚Äôt hear a word they were saying. At that distance, the therapist would have the client say things like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to fuck that little girl.‚Äù By having the client say this out loud, they would then realize that these intrusive thoughts are very far from the truth, and it would significantly help them ease their anxiety. However, on a post I read, everyone was saying how looking for reassurance is always a negative thing (including a mod). In this post, someone discussed how it‚Äôs not okay for someone with POCD to look up child porn for the sake of feeling disgust and realizing they‚Äôre not into it. Which I agree with. But then everyone in the comments was explaining how someone with POCD would never even do this, and that reassurance doesn‚Äôt work. This contradicts the study I read about using this reassurance to treat POCD. So now I‚Äôm confused ? Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, I really appreciate it üíú and an extra thank you if you take the time to answer ‚ù§Ô∏è I would just really like to hear your feedback so I can correct any misunderstandings I have

So I was accepted to study at Oxford next spring, which is AMAZING, but all I can think about with my somatoform OCD is what if I just have a constant urge to pee the whole time?, what if I die before then?, what if I develop motor neuron disease symptoms when Im there?, etc. so Im afraid I wont even be able to enjoy it...Im so tired of running the same calculations for this rare disease Ive been worried about for a year but I feel like I have to do it. Im not saying what it is to prevent others from going down the same rabbit hole, but the incidence rate is 0.6 per 100,000 people every year, which is 0.000006%, and its about the same, if not more rare, than getting struck by lightning, and thats even for the age group it commonly affects (55-60, Im only 20 :/). Getting ALS at my age is more common than this!! HOW am I worried about this?? I talked to my doctor twice about it and she hadnt even heard of the disease... she also doesnt think I need to see a urologist or neurologist and recommended me to a pelvic floor therapist, and is also the most concerned about my anxiety. My family is probably losing patience with me even though they have said they are trying their best to be supportive.Im worried ERP wont work. Im worried Ill have to go on a new med. Im sick of thinking about my bladder every day for a year. I guess what Im trying to say is Im feeling hopeless with OCD and on some level, I wonder if I even want to treat it because on one hand its making me feel safe, but on the other I dont want to live in fear. Also, if anyone has tips for somatoform OCD, that would be so helpful, Im so tired of hyperfocusing on my body.

So, Ive had this problem for a while now, and Im not sure how to specifically challenge it.​For the past couple of years, likely as a way to fight intrusive thoughts, I developed the method of thinking [using my internal voice, yknow like when you read] what Im going to do as Im doing it. For example, when I want to take a drink of my soda I pick it up and think in my head to take a drink. The reason it started was to assure myself that Im doing it for xyz reason and not to subconsciously affirm my OCD/intrusive thoughts and fears, but now Im in quite the predicament.​Often Ill know what I want to do, but I get caught up on having to think it in my head and will think the phrase out...but not do the action because Im worried about the phrase not being perfectly thought out. Additionally, even if I think the phrase out and KNOW Im doing it for that reason...I still end up being frozen for a few seconds as I mentally do the steps. It usually results in some pretty intense fatigue and migraines and Ive been trying to stop, but to no avail.  What are some methods that could potentially help?

I have physical compulsions, I don‚Äôt know everything of course but I know that the physical compulsions don‚Äôt cause me as much stress and anxiety. It‚Äôs the mental that fucks me up so badly. Most of my physical compulsions have to do with things feeling ‚Äúright.‚Äù The mental, I struggle with the fear that everything is pointless and that I‚Äôm depressed or sometimes bipolar. (Not saying there is anything wrong with either of those things whatsoever It‚Äôs just something that I have developed a fear of having for quite some time.) my mental compulsions are usually, for example, I‚Äôll just be hanging out or scrolling, I‚Äôll scroll past something, and my thought will be ‚Äúif what I just scrolled past had the word influence then I‚Äôm going to be okay‚Äù that‚Äôs just an example. The worst ones that cause me stress are for example, i think of something that I like that would cause me happiness and excitement and i imagine myself doing it in the future or whatever and if it doesn‚Äôt excite me and it feels pointless and I dread it I start thinking I‚Äôm depressed. Basically, my head does these little check ins to make sure I‚Äôm ‚Äúhappy‚Äù or ‚Äúokay.‚Äù If i do feel excited about it and if i don‚Äôt dread it it‚Äôll make me feel better and I‚Äôll know I‚Äôm not depressed. If i don‚Äôt and it feels hopeless and pointless it‚Äôll make me super depressed. I know that it‚Äôs important to stop compulsions as much as i don‚Äôt want to stop this one because it makes me feel better.

I have Pure-O OCD (HOCD and POCD). I have this fear of being accused of or accidently doing something heinous or innapropriate. Anytime I am in a situation or scenario, I look for triggers or factors where something heinous or innapropriate could happen and I try to avoid it.I have had these issues for a while but started noticing these in my early teens (14-15). Is he hiding something?)What should I do? How should I go about this?

I have a memory and unlike most of my memories it is not something I can tell is real or false. I have dream-reality confusion and that has led to a lot of confusing memories. But I can usually verify they are ‚Äòreal‚Äô or not via feeling or others. I know this memory was either a dream or I was half-awake half-asleep when the event occurred. So that makes it hard to know or not. Unlike my other memories I cant know if it was real or fake deep down. I even remember doubting if it was real or fake the day after the event occurred. Somehow for a while I didnt even think about it, I guess I just assumed it was a dream until I got triggered by a video that vaguely reminded me of it and started my real event ocd as a whole. However, especially recently I have been doubting if it is real or not at all. I also cant recall what happened before or after the memory which isnt common for me. The memory was doing something not appropriate as a teen. I just genuinely want to be a good person so bad and I feel like this memory if ai can figure it out will either mean I can have a happy life or dont deserve happiness. Has anyone figured out a way to tell the differences between false and real memories? Should I go into my mind and try to find out? See if I know if its real or fake deep down? Has meds helped anyone distinguish between false and real memories?

So, ive had on and off TOCD/Gender OCD. (I‚Äôm a cis girl, ive always been super girly and such) But now my OCD has latched onto something involving a friend of mine. I am a supporter of LGBTQ, nothing wrong with being trans or of a different gender identity! I deal with pure O thought, rn it‚Äôs fixated on Gender identity. Ik this is OCD bc i didn‚Äôt have thoughts like these before. So, My friend was genderfluid and they went by two names. Male and female. And then came out as a trans female. I‚Äôm happy for them! But now my mind is like ‚ÄúWhat if you‚Äôre genderfluid? What if you pick out a male name and go by two names? What if you become trans after this? What if you started acting masculine or started feeling masculine??‚Äù And this freaked me the fuck out. And it keeps convincing me that i want that, but i don‚Äôt. It doesn‚Äôt sound like me and it really scares me. :( It doesn‚Äôt feel like me, but OCD says i should accept it and that i‚Äôm denying who i am. It also got triggered when i kept thinking about a character that is also genderfluid, and my brain kept convincing me that bc i related to the character (For the looks and quirky personality) meant i was genderfluid. I‚Äôm hyperaware of pronouns again and even being called a girl :/. And even though TOCD calmed down for a bit, i would still have gender related thoughts that didn‚Äôt align with me, but i ignored them and went about my day. It doesn‚Äôt help that OCD is like ‚ÄúThis time it‚Äôs the real thing! It‚Äôs different!‚Äù For anyone asking, i am on medication. Prozac 10 mg (Gonna go up to 20 mg next month.)

Hi! Basically, two years ago I developed multiple skin conditions. Started with perioral dermatitis, followed by some sort of acne, followed by the most horrible eczema flare-up (on my face and body) from an allergic reaction. This reaction was painful, itchy, embarrassing, and lasted two full months before it started to recover. I couldnt sleep at all, didnt leave my house, eating was difficult, etc. Following this, I now seem to be developing some form of rosacea. I think the reaction just messed up my skin big-time. While I do see a doctor regularly for these things, these occurrences + my OCD have absolutely ruined my life. Ive ruined the skin on my hands because I wash them so often due to being scared of touching things that could irritate the skin on my face, I check the mirror religiously for new symptoms, and I barely go anywhere except the grocery store to avoid coming in contact with potential irritants. I live in fear 24/7 of this happening again. I can tell some people in my life are frustrated by this and dont understand how I dont just get over it. I get their frustration, but this was one of the worst, most painful experiences of my life and I dont think I could handle going through it again. I honestly dont know what I want to gain from posting this, maybe just to vent,  but if anyone has advice or similar experiences Im glad to hear it. Thanks for listening if you did!

Hi, my wife suffers from extreme OCD in almost all the ways you can. From contamination to concerns with death. Things are poisonous, she cant go to bed until a certain time to lower the chances of her being murder. Doors being locked, ect. There are a lot of different aspects of it that include her. Now, I feel like I am at a breaking point.I find myself suffering from anxiety about not wanting to trigger her. From cleaning supplies I use to my hands being washed, to body wash and things that I use religiously. I dont know if thats really me trying to be supportive or if Im trying to avoid conflict with her. But I really want to help. I see from a lot of people that that is conceived as aiding her in her compulsions which I also dont want to do. At this point, I dont know what to do or how to help but I feel like I am getting extremely overwhelmed. That might be selfish of me to say because I cant even imagine how overwhelming it is for her but Im really struggling.I recently had a discussion with her that I would like her to attend therapy or possibly psychiatry if she needs it for her anxiety. She informed that the psychiatrist wouldnt help because medication is one of her triggers (which this is true, she struggles with basic ibuprofen) and that therapy would take a very long time to help her. Not to mention that it would make things way more stressful for her trying to do exposure therapy because its her normal anxietys tenfold. Is there any other options for treatment I could offer? I settled with just saying I would like to see a couples counseler so we could work on our communication however I feel the need to ask others with her issues whether or not Im overstepping a line and what I can do to help. I understand that it will not go away and that it can be a permanent illness 99 percent of the time. But is it wrong of me to ask to work on it? Is it selfish to feel overwhelmed Signed a very concerned lover of someone with ocd.

Ive always liked how OCD was called the doubting disease. When you are caught in the state of chronic doubt, everything you try to analyze can automatically be put in question: your identity, your feelings, your values, your love, your actions. Each one of those things becomes inacessible because you try to make sense of it from a state of such intense unclarity that automatically muddles whatever you lay your eyes on. When in the grip of OCD, we lose touch with our feelings, with who we spontaneously are. And this particular event is the biggest problem, especially in Pure O. Not being able to access the feelings creates a profound split. Who am I without my feelings? How can I like myself without access to the only thing that makes me human? What do you guys think, is this where the low self-esteem, so common in OCD, comes from?

On todays episode of why does my OCD look nothing like everyone elses, I basically never checked anything ever, in my entire life, up to and including about $100 a semester in dorm lockout fees because god forbid I ask myself if I have my keys *before* I lock the door  Then I got my own place, and after living on my own about a year, it just kind of hit me that Im the only one responsible for all the big stuff. Which has led to a lot of checking. SO much checking. Left the keys in the door when I went to bed? Gotta check that now. Left the house and forgot some candles? Gotta keep all the candles in the designated candle area and check when I pass them. To sum up, I managed to just *give* myself a new mental disorder I didnt have yesterdayIt feels really weird being this aware of the obsessions, because I can so clearly and recently remember not having them, which just adds to the ugh why am I like this, and then the more I read up on it or hear people talk about it, its like Im the only person with OCD who just kinda woke up with it one day, like brain wtf?

I was diagnosed with OCD about three months ago, and in retrospect I have been dealing with OCD for a very long time, ever since I was around 12-13. I had an intense fear of germs and washed my hands often, and had a big problem with magical thinking and seeking reassurance about things that in retrospect was likely OCD. But these problems subsided as I got a bit older, and essentially disappeared as I finished middle school and entered high school. This was until last November, where I got sexually assaulted during my senior year of high school. This fucking destroyed me, it made me a nervous wreck at school, and I began avoiding certain routes around school like the plague to avoid the dude who assaulted me. This, in my mind upon reflecting, reignited my OCD, and it consumed my life. I cant engage in any hobbies anymore, my skin is bleeding and cracking from constant hand washing, my magical thinking is coming back (I can manage it pretty well, thankfully). I spiraled and had to be put into an intensive inpatient psychiatric program and attend group therapy, which made my grades suffer. My therapist has explained to me that I am experiencing severe trauma over how other boys at school have treated me (I used to be bullied for being gay), and it makes me so angry how someone can just‚Ä¶. destroy my mental health and go about like its nothing. Yesterday was prom, I saw on social media this dude who assaulted me was having fun and enjoying himself and being popular or whatever, which I wasn‚Äôt able to go because I knew I would have a mental breakdown seeing that person again, and the bright lights and loudness would overwhelm me. Im just extremely upset by this, I know I shouldn‚Äôt let the actions of others steal my joy, but being sexually assaulted absolutely destroyed me and seemed to kick my OCD into fucking overdrive.

I want control. Not like Im a control freak. But I want some control over my life. Control I dont feel I have. Currently I go through the motions of School, work, music shit, usually gone from 6:30 - 8:00 or so. My parents always wanted me to do shit every day when I only have 1 or 2 days off a week. my girlfriends mom controls my relationship using dictatorial fear. And yeah I have control I get to make decisions. But if I make the decision I want for my health people are upset and attack me. So I have no control. And its why I do a lot of what I do. I freak out and have attacks about time and my schedule, I freak out when people tell me to feel differently than Im feeling. Even if theyre telling me to breathe and feel better. Theyre telling me to do something different. Im not in control of many things in my own life. I didnt realize it until recently and I couldnt put it into words but the more I think the more thats what it is. Sounds bad, but Im just happy I finally have a somewhat Freudian origin for my insanity. Have a good day all.

I feel like so many of us have heightened ocd around medication whether it be health ocd, or schizo ocd, or harm ocd, etc, so we don‚Äôt take it because ‚Äúmaybe I‚Äôll harm someone on the meds‚Äù or ‚Äúwhat if these meds do something bad to me‚Äù or ‚Äúwhat if I don‚Äôt actually have ocd and then I‚Äôm taking these meds for no reason‚ÄùThis is what I call the ocd medication paradox. You don‚Äôt allow yourself to the resource because of ocd, and the resource can potentially make you feel better. And you keep restricting yourself from the resource because of the ocd that it may inevitable help. I have waited my entire life and I‚Äôm finally starting meds soon. I‚Äôm ready to attempt another solution that I have always put off. I was told that it isn‚Äôt natural and that I‚Äôll get addicted to it or I‚Äôll endure terrible side effects. I am ready to accept this uncertainty. I have endured so much ocd pain, feeling suicidal, etc due to ocd. If you have pocd and pure o you know the special hell it puts you in. I am ready to try the resources that are available to me. I don‚Äôt care about the judgement. And if I feel worse, I am ready to be in outpatient/inpatient therapy. Instead of being afraid of getting help I am finally embracing it. It feels liberating.

So around november I was diagnosed with OCD and struggled severely with my thoughts, like, I was seriously depressed and couldnt function at the thoughts of my thoughts actually being real. But I started taking medication for it around December and I noticed a big difference lately. Before whenever a topic came up that had to deal with my OCD, I would go into complete panic. like everytime, I got that heart-sink feeling where my face went cold at the thought of my thoughts becoming a reality. But this time, I notice when a topic comes up, I dont really get anxious anymore, It just bothers me, which is honestly great! It does bother me, and I start to overthink about it, but I notice I dont get as anxious as I used to, I just get a little scared, then the thought slowly fades away little by little.Before I used to think about a thought day and night, scared to eat because I feel like I would throw up from my anxiety, but today I was actually drinking coffee when I came upon an anxious thought, and noticed I didnt get too scared! I do have my ups and downs and sometimes this anxiety attacks might get a little bad, but its definitely so much better than a year ago, I couldnt even look at certain things without breaking down. Now, when I see certain things, yes thoughts pop up, but Im trying to learn and cope with my ocd and in a way, cooperate with it, you know? This gives me a lot of hope, and I hope it gives other people too, that ocd is there almost as like, a friend. A friend who is extremely anxious and bothers you all day with horrible thoughts, yet in the end, is filling your head with those thoughts because they want you to be safe and keep your expectations low. So you have to help your friend, calm them down, and reason with them. Thats what I percieve of it and I think its helping me to think of it that way.

So I have some very specific things that affect me and make me feel that kind of instant aversion feeling. I have pretty heavy dermatillomania and some germ/cleanliness related OCD, so i know the feeling and i feel it everytime im interacting with or living with dogs. They smell bad, they drool, they track dirt, you have to pick up their waste when you take them out,  they constantly are licking themselves or trying to lick me, or staring at me while i eat anything, and its just honestly a sensory nightmare. I have intense guilt about this sometimes because its hard to tell people you dont like dogs. I dont hate dogs, I just find them incredibly overwhelming and unclean. But this is hard to explain to people who are used to them and dont think too hard about it.I love my gf, we moved in together and she has a dog. When I can handle it i like to say hi to him and pet him so he knows hes a sweet boy and i have love for him, but theres always something that grosses me out and triggers this extreme aversion that lasts the rest of the day. I try to overexplain to her due to my guilt when I tell the dog to stop licking itself, or when I lead him out of the room so i can feel actually alone, but I dont feel like explaining it helps. I need to figure out a way to cope with these feelings without seeming completely aloof to my gfs dog.(To clarify; ive told her that her dog is her dog, she hasnt made me take him out ever, she takes care of him, id never make her get rid of her dog or anything, just want to be able to stop feeling so guilty over my aversion)

Hi all. Just wondering if other people experience something similar. So the way I try and describe it, is being stuck down a well. In the well Im completely stuck with my ocd thoughts, constantly trying to escape them, then arguing with them, then believe them, then try to use logic to find an answer to them or why has this happened to me. Does not have to be in that order but all of those just cycle around in my head. I cant ever get out of that headspace or I dont have the mental capacity to think about something else or let the thoughts go, everything gets related back to my ocd thoughts. Only getting temporary relief from distractions,checking etc. Sometimes though and I would say and medication helps it feels like Im out of the well. Unsure how I actually got out, often feels like I didnt try but unsure how I didnt try if ya get me but my mind doesnt feel trapped or stuck in a mindset. I can actually think outside of my ocd thoughts. I often feel this is how I used to live or how people without ocd think, its refreshing.

I wish I could erase all memory of all the shit I‚Äôve googled, because if I hadn‚Äôt, I wouldn‚Äôt be fearing things that I never needed to know about. If I didn‚Äôt know schizophrenia or psychosis existed, I‚Äôd not fear it or convince myself I had it, there‚Äôs so much I wish I didn‚Äôt know. This is daily fucking torture, constantly checking if I‚Äôm seeing things, hearing things, even though I‚Äôm not. I‚Äôm exhausted by this, it‚Äôs depressing & on top of all of this I have DPDR, so I not only question my sanity, but I don‚Äôt even recognise who I am anymore, I‚Äôve no identity other than this sick existence. I‚Äôm sorry to rant, I‚Äôm just really down and grieving for my former life, a time where this didn‚Äôt exist.This year was meant to be the best year of my life, I‚Äôve a 1 year old daughter, I‚Äôve sold one property and bought another, my company had some great projects lined up, and one fucking panic attack from my intrusive thoughts has ruined this, 4 months I‚Äôve had to be off work because I can‚Äôt function.Beyond upset, I‚Äôve no motivation or individuality whatsoever anymore, I just know I can‚Äôt pass on this pain to my daughter and family. Again, I‚Äôm sorry for this, I just needed to get it off my chest without upsetting my family. I‚Äôd rather fear/question anything else but my sanity, because it opens up so many rabbit holes and un-answerable questions.

I have contamination OCD. I wash my hands too much, divide my living spaces into clean areas and unclean areas, etc. And I also have all sorts of other OCD things. I have to think the right thought when closing my bedroom door at night. I have to leave my slippers in this weird, very specific position. My phone needs to rest on the floor at a 45 degree angle in relation to the wall. I have OCD prayers I have to do, and I have to do them seven times. Etc.The thing is this: knowing that Im definitely OCD helps me think about my COCD critically. It helps me realize that the contamination is just in my head. Its not objective. Its just another morbid OCD obsession, as silly as my obsessions with angles and numbers.Anyway, how about you? Do you strictly have COCD? Are there people with strictly COCD? Or do most people who have OCD also have COCD and vice-versa? Im trying to get a clearer picture of this phenomenon. Id appreciate any feedback here.

I started taking sertraline around mid February on 25 mgs. The lowest standard dose for OCD is usually 50 mgs but I experienced an improvement in symptoms after only 4 days. It was like a miracle. The drug along with affective therapy made my OCD symptoms almost non existent. Ive also dealt with ADHD like symptoms my whole life. Ive never been diagnosed and theres actually a disagreement among experts if whether ADHD like symptoms care actually caused by ADHD or if theyre caused by OCD. All I know is after 3 weeks, I was able to think the clearest I ever had. I always believed I was just a naturally lazy person who took short cuts cause I sucked. But when this medication kicked in, I was so insanely productive and focused. I was able to read things and absorb the information without having to re read something 15 times and doing chores was no longer a monumental stress and effort. I just did things and did them well with attention to detail. About 3 weeks ago though I felt myself starting to slip back into bad habits and all the positive side effects are gone. I finally increased my dose to 50 a week ago and have been experiencing terrible memory, lack of focus, and lack of motivation. Can anyone relate and give advice on what to expect with this increase? I want to know if my experience is typical and if anyone else has been able to keep the positive side effects of their SSRI. My intrusive thoughts are almost nonexistant now (thank God) but the side effects are making my life really hard right now.

So keep holding on.

I wonder if anyone here once had a moment where you would read stuffs online about certain mental illness and then unbeknownst to you, your OCD starts making up the symptoms and it felt so real you start to worry it could be the case?For example, this week, I randomly went into an extensive research about DID/OSDD after someone mentioned it in my social media. I was convinced I had it, not to mention it got backed up with the fact I have a space since 2012 where I would retract myself into it for comfort (yet it doesnt feel like my feelings...?). It even summoned an alter I talked in my head with. However, i noticed some red flags and suspected this is OCD acting up such as the symptoms coming out of nowhere after I looked it up and the alter doesnt know anything about my past.I finally got to talk with my therapist two days ago, and told me that while my experiences are valid, its actually my OCD and BPD comorbiding (obsession + feeling empty). And when I talked to one of my friends about the result, they brought up an article about how people with OCD would likely hallucinate things, including this experience. My therapist also mentioned im highly imaginative, hence the space, but its not a system. Its OCD using it against me. Since then, the alter disappeared. While im thankful there isnt much to find other than BPD and OCD, the fact it can do stuffs like this is honestly dangerous. But i wanna know if anyone has experienced something similar to this before and i want to know what do you feel about this.

I mainly suffer from real event OCD, and I have done so many things I could think of for a while, like apologizing to some related people, acting at the time what I think is properly from the guilt and usually Im right back to feeling where I started in a few hours. Its never enough.I know this is a compulsion, but at the same time, it intermeshes with basic advice, like you should apologize, making amends, etc. when you feel guilty which can be genuinely good advice in most cases.But since OCD has latched on, the line of thinking never ends:Is my whole existences sole purpose now to serve this person/other people and never do anything for my sole fun or enjoyment?What do I deserve?Do you need to confess to that one person?Is this guilt excessive or valid?Is there any other amends I could make?Did I know better? Was I disadvantaged anddidnt really know better because of my age and/or mental ilness?Do I need to confess more?What if someone brings up the event againlater? What will happen?What if my therapists so far were just extranice?What about that one person who saidsomething really negative when you confessedthat one time?My torment never ends. And now I have existential OCD branching from this. Im so done with life, but even if I tried to quit who knows what would happen after.

It has taken me a while to become self aware about this but I realized recently that one of the major reasons I am so anti-religion is because of how much the combination of OCD and religious indoctrination damaged me as a kid.The worst thing you can tell someone with OCD is that their thoughts are their fault and/or mark them as a bad person, and growing up Christian I was always being told that God could see our thoughts and that you could sin just by thinking. I remember sitting in church freaking out because I thought I had a bad thought about God.And the idea of hell, which is emotionally abusive and incredibly sadistic to start with, made it so, so, so much worse. I grew up always thinking I was destined for hell unless I could repent. I would be constantly having sinful intrusive thoughts. Even now, as a full grown adult who no longer believes in God or in anything religious or spiritual, I still have panic attacks about going to hell for being an atheist because I cant stop thinking but what if.Theres also the fact that the reason I didnt go to therapy for 17 years, even when as a kid I was washing my hands until they were bleeding and never sleeping at night, was because my parents thought God would help me if I just prayed about it. In high school, when I was having an anxiety attack and couldnt stop crying, they said it must be because I dont have God in my heart.So when people ask why I am such a militant atheist it takes everything in my power not to launch into a massive trauma dump

Ive suffered with OCD since I was 12. As of lately, Ive worried a lot about time. About existence. About having enough time.My fear makes me not want to do ANYTHING. Im scared to do anything fun, because I dread missing it after Im done. I wish I could stay in the moment forever. But even if I do just sit at home and do nothing except cower in fear about how old Im getting, and how things arent the same as when I was a kid; times just gonna pass me by, and Im not gonna be able to enjoy the time I have now.Im really scared of not living my life to the fullest and laying in my deathbed with regrets, but this fear has been trying to completely paralyze me.Im still really scared, and sometimes I wish time would slow down, but I dont control that. Even if I dont like that fact, I need to accept it, and slowly, I believe I am. If I live in one moment forever, I wont get to experience new, and better ones. I can reminisce all I want, but that isnt going to make time go backwards, slow down, or stop. I just wanted to make this to provide some comfort to those who maybe feel a similar way to me. Well be okay, and I really hope that this post made you feel a bit better, even if it was just for a second. I love each and everyone of you, even if we are strangers, and I want to support you all üòåBut that wraps up this quick post. Im getting ready to go to Fiesta, and Im excited :)

My OCD has gotten so much better with medication and therapy. It has made me appreciate so many things. The thing I appreciate the most is being able to use the bathroom. A task that filled me with so much fear I would avoid it until it was painful and damaging my health. I genuinely smile and get filled with so much happiness after a quick and easy pee. I wash my hands once, for 20 seconds and thats it. No more second guessing, no more fear I didnt do it right. Just going about my day. So what has OCD made you appreciate?

idk when it started but for months i‚Äôve had an ocd obsession about getting a panic attack. i spend every second of every day doing compulsions to avoid getting one in upcoming events - for example: my exams, going on holidays (where i‚Äôd need to sit in a car or plane for extended periods of time), being in public transport, etc. i‚Äôve never had it when i‚Äôm alone or chilling somewhere even, it‚Äôs always when i‚Äôm out. i did an exam yesterday and spent the entire 2 hours worrying about panicking - when i think about the possibility of me panicking i actually bring myself into an attack, i start to feel the symptoms coming on and i do everything to try and bring myself out of it. thankfully it‚Äôs never became a full blown attack - but i‚Äôve been close. i‚Äôm constantly planning my escape routes. when i don‚Äôt think about it, i never have panic attacks. it‚Äôs only when i‚Äôm worrying about having one it comes on. funnily though, i‚Äôve not had one since 2021 (before my ocd even became bad). it‚Äôs all in my head. i just feel them coming on really often and somehow work myself down from it everytime. i just don‚Äôt want this to rule my life anymore, and most of all i don‚Äôt want it to cause me to have a full blown panic attack in a situation that isn‚Äôt ideal (the exam hall). i feel ashamed and frustrated more than anything. it‚Äôs mainly because i‚Äôm a dude and i feel pathetic to be a guy with anxiety. ik thats very internalised. idk. i don‚Äôt suffer from panic attacks i just suffer from a fear of embarrassing myself with having one and/or losing control of my body and feelings. i‚Äôm sick of the compulsions ive been doing regarding my upcoming exam (in 4 days). any advice? i‚Äôve already done therapy.

I remember having thoughts about killing my family or kissing my friends, these thoughts would make me feel uncomfortable and annoyed. Shit, since i was a little kid i dealt with this and it took me almost 9 years to figure out that i wasnt crazy, but was dealing with a mental disease. There was also that one time id really doubt my sexuality, i thought i was gay, even thought ive never felt any kind of attraction towards men. Hello, this isnt exactly a crisis mode Im just exhausted. Anywho I have BDD about my body and my hair. I am an 18M, 5 8 ~ 100 lbs 45 kgAnd I style my hair every day to an unhealthy level. My hair style is basically that of Steve Harrington from Stranger things. Cool, good and visualized. I have to make my hair look perfect. When I do it I have to take a shower and wash it then spend 25 minutes doing a very specific routine* that if you care Ill put it below. And often it doesnt feel or look perfect. Even if it looks good its not going to stay that way and its few and far between, the times where it doesnt go wrong or doesnt make me freak out and have to take a 2nd or 3rd shower to do it all again. And the worst part is when there are times when I think I have it figured out and its good for a week or maybe even 2 and then it fucks up again for months and I spend all day every day looking at it, worrying, fixing it and breaking down when I cant. I just want it to be easy and I dont want to have to constantly worry about it anymore. I just want the good times to be common and the bad times off days not the other way around. And I feel like I need to fix it but I never can seem to do it right. Shit sucks :(*Hair is damp and towel dried MousseComb mouse inBlow dry back and forth with specific motionsBlow dry forwardBlow dry upside downBlow dry back and forth upside down Blow dry hair forward upside down Blow dry upPut sea salt spray in hairRepeat all blow dry steps GelHairspray

For example: I just got back from a trip on Monday. Ive had back to back interviews, work, and a bunch of random home projects this week to deal with. My gym cycle has been thrown off as well as my grocery cycle. Basically, I cant just decide to go to the gym on a random day. It has to be the start of a week cycle, aka a normal routine. That way, I can mentally prepare myself to handle gym, work, life, etc. Its not that I dont want to go to the gym. I just cant? This goes with pretty much anything. I cant just go to the store. It has to be on certain days or periods of the week. Mostly, if I close at work, I cant go because I know I wont have any me time between the store hoping and work. So, I wait till a short day at work or a day off. Its always been hard for me to just do random things because I need a routine. And when my routine is disrupted, I have to wait until the next cycle starts in order to start doing the thing again. Does that make sense? ü§î Anywho. ( F19) So, i know this is going to sound absolutely insane, and it‚Äôs so hard for me to talk about and i‚Äôm so nervous to say this because i have yet to find something that someone says similar to what i‚Äôm gonna say as far as OCD compulsions, but basically, I have struggled with OCD for so long and false memory ocd, therefore one day, i figured if i constantly just have an audio recorder on throughout my day, all the time, that way i can ‚Äú make sure ‚Äú nothing bad happened or that i didn‚Äôt do anything bad during the day, so all the time, i have an audio recorder on my phone recording myself throughout the day for reassurance so i don‚Äôt have to ask or seek it. I KNOW this is not normal and I KNOW i made it difficult for myself to ever overcome this compulsion because without the audio recorder on i go into panic mode until it‚Äôs on again. I feel like if it‚Äôs not on , i won‚Äôt have certainty and reassurance and the thoughts of me being the worst person to ever exist start coming to my mind again. i hate myself for this because i know how abnormal it is, i can‚Äôt believe i‚Äôm this mentally i‚Äôll and i feel like it will never get better and the reason i haven‚Äôt talked about this compulsion is because fear of judgement and i feel like people will think i‚Äôm crazy, and yes , ocd makes me feel crazy in so many different ways all the time. However, i never knew how to approach this problem with the audio recording compulsion, i know the standard treatment for ocd is ERP. But i don‚Äôt know where to start with that, i‚Äôm just scared that it‚Äôs never going to get better. I‚Äôm so depressed and miserable constantly reassurance seeking but it feels like i need reassurance about everything i do to not feel like a horrible person . i want to be normal.
